text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 15th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
In the evening, when he returns from work, he takes the elevator to the 10th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining five floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 15th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator down every morning to the ground floor and then, in the evening, goes up to the 10th floor and walks up five more floors.
But on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 15th floor.
Hmm, that's a bit puzzling.
Let me break it down.
First, he lives on the 15th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor, which is the 1st floor.
So that's 14 floors down.
In the evening, after work, he takes the elevator up to the 10th floor and then walks up five floors to his apartment.
Wait, so from the 10th to the 15th is five floors.
That makes sense.
But why doesn't he just take the elevator all the way up in the evening? Oh, but on rainy days, he does take the elevator all the way to the 15th floor.
So maybe there's something about the weather affecting his routine.
Maybe the elevator isn't working properly on rainy days, or maybe he doesn't want to get wet walking up the stairs.
Or perhaps the elevator is faster, and he doesn't mind paying a little extra or something.
Wait, maybe it's about saving time or money.
Taking the elevator all the way up would save him five floors of walking.
But why doesn't he do that every day? Maybe on rainy days, he doesn't want to walk up the stairs because they might be slippery or wet.
So he takes the elevator instead.
That makes sense because on rainy days, walking up five floors could be dangerous.
So the main reason is that on rainy days, walking up the stairs isn't safe, so he uses the elevator all the way.
But on normal days, he takes the elevator only part of the way and walks the rest because maybe the stairs are easier or he prefers walking for some reason.
I think that's the key here.
The man's routine changes on rainy days to avoid walking up the stairs, which could be a safety hazard.
So the solution is that he takes the elevator all the way up on rainy days to stay dry and safe.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way up to the 15th floor on rainy days because walking up the stairs would be unsafe due to the risk of slipping or getting wet.
Therefore, he uses the elevator to maintain safety and dryness during inclement weather.
